website_summaries.verdict: This classic notebook is great for use for journaling, writing, notes and sketching with pencils and light pens.
cons: Better for journaling or writing than for art unless you're using pencil

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Compare to the old Moleskine I just filled ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Compare to the old Moleskine I just filled up, the new one's paper quality is much worse. It's totally see through and I don't know how I will be able to write on the backside of the pages without making both sides unreadable. Attached a photo showing a comparison of writing on my old Moleskine and this new one.
customer_reviews.author: Fan Fei

customer_reviews.title: Favorite notebooks
customer_reviews.text: These moleskine notebooks are my favorite for my college notes. Good paper quality-- thick enough for the gel pens I use. Pilot G-2 size 07 and .35 Pilot precise pens
customer_reviews.author: Sam Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Paper too thin.
customer_reviews.text: First Moleskine product I've ever owned, and I don't know if its just me being spoiled with sketch paper for so long- but the paper is SO THIN. This would have been perfect since it's college ruled with a nice cover and an envelope for loose papers in the back but- even when I write with just pencil, you can see the shadow on the other side. Makes notes look a tad messy and I can't write in pen or use any highlighter. Won't repurchase :(
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: One Small Kink
customer_reviews.text: This is such a beautiful notebook! It big but it's smaller than most of my sketchbooks. The softcover bends back so when you want to work on a page, you can just fold your notebook with the cover creasing!! The only problem is that although you can use ink without it bleeding through, you can still see through the page, with or without ink. Other than that, it makes a great travel journal!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Reyes

customer_reviews.title: I had to remove one star for sturdiness and for receptivity to fountain ink
customer_reviews.text: I write with a fountain pen (piston type). This was purchased as a journal to track my certification studies. I really needed this to be able to be carried daily, AND to not need to blot the ink before I turn the page. I've used the pen on many paper types, and while this is receptive and certainly smooth, it holds the ink at the surface for longer than some of the other journals I've used. I think it would be better suited for the $15-19 price point, unless they can improve the porosity of the paper without compromising the smooth texture. It can be done, and has been at the price point I have indicated.
customer_reviews.author: AdriannicusTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: These notebooks make bullet journals a cinch. If you're looking for a notebook that can handle fountain pens or heavy inks, look elsewhere. This notebook does well with gel pens and roller ball pens, writing pencils and colored pencils. The grids make it really easy to configure your lists, boxes, and even your doodles. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: makes you feel more like an author or poet jotting stuff down
customer_reviews.text: A little more expensive than you really need to pay for a composition notebook, but it's a little classier looking, makes you feel more like an author or poet jotting stuff down, instead of an absent minded guy like me just trying to remember what errands to run this weekend!
customer_reviews.author: It's just me

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful Ordering these from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: These sketchbooks are wonderful, the paper is smooth and thin and the book itself is flexible in a wonderful, portable way. It is a very comfortable sketchbook. However having bought a few of these from Amazon now, I've never received one without a dent that affects every page of the book. One was in the very center of the book. I'm too passive and lazy to return them for this reason but it would be nice if Amazon would start packing them better, and stop dropping them, or juggling them, whichever it is.
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Nice journal.
customer_reviews.text: I really love the style of this. I’ve bought cheap journals and expensive ones. This worked for me in the past. I just got this yesterday evening. I’m annoyed because the corners are kinda smashed and bent. This might seem small to others but not to me. It’s a simple and nice looking journal til you look at the corners. Not very happy about that. But that could be the delivery guys fault. My suggestion would be to package a little better. This was wrapped in a thin piece of clear plastic and in a large envelope with a thin layer of bubble wrap. The journal is great. The corners just mess it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Moleskines!
customer_reviews.text: I love Moleskines!! The fact that I can get them in this wonderful softcover (which doesn't make the cover crease too badly when I bend it over on itself a lot) makes my heart smile. The size is great, too; I csn't seem to find softcover journals this large from other sellers. The pages are a lovely cream color, and, while there is some ghosting (I use Pigma Micron 03s), it's not terrible or distracting. I was able to color pretty heavily using Tombow Dual Brush Pens, and had no bleed-through. I own two of these things, and I'll probably buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Do not order this product if you intend to use it as a sketchbook.
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy sketching, don't order this product. Like many others have said, it is the perfect size. However, the pages are thinner than regular printer paper. This should not even be advertised as a sketch book. The paper is not even remotely art quality. I'm not one to write reviews, and I wont be returning it because I should have taken the time to more carefully read through the reviews, but I want to stop others from making the same mistake I did. I've ordered smaller moleskine sketchbooks before and didn't have the same issue with paper quality.
customer_reviews.author: Danica

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. The generic brands are better.
customer_reviews.text: I was using one of the generic brands of these notebooks so I figured the Moleskine would have to be better or at least the same... it was not. The pages are too thin, causing bleed through/ghosting, and the paper itself can't handle ink from gel pens without smearing. 10 minutes after writing something with gel ink, it still smeared everywhere. Didn't have any of these problems with the generic brands and they're less than half the price of the Moleskine! Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Pasha Bean

customer_reviews.title: College Ruled!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not knowing whether it was wide ruled or college ruled. College ruled is important to me, so I am pleased. Great quality notebook, a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: JanineB

customer_reviews.title: Hybrid between the squared and plain moleskines
customer_reviews.text: Love moleskine notebooks. This one is interesting bc it has dots on the page. This is actually quite useful as I am an engineer and sometimes the squared pages of a moleskine are too limiting and with the plain pages I end up writing at an angle so at least with the dots I can write in larger script/print and can use the dots as guides for a straight line and for drawing diagrams. This notebook has extra large pages I can fit quite a few notes on each page. And the dots are not distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Chronic Shopper C

customer_reviews.title: Paper is super thin
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Pocket Sturdy cover Comes in the larger size (why I bought it) Cons: You can see any markings straight through the paper. I used a fine tipped pen made for bullet journaling on one page and the other side is NOT usable for text as you can see EVERYTHING straight though the paper. I even used pencil to mark out some additional pages and you can see it on the other side. It is basically 2 steps up from tracing paper. If you are looking for something you can doodle on and make pretty with markers/pens this is NOT the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey L.

customer_reviews.title: It's very good at what it does
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased approximately 5 variations of this notebook. It's very good at what it does. I prefer the blue to the beige/tope, which looks a bit like a russet potato skin. The notebook is very well bound with high quality paper that doesn't feather when I use my fountain pens on it. The pocket in the back is nice. It's not quite big enough to store a full page of letter paper unfolded. Dot Grid allows me to use the page as needed without having to worry about being in or out of the lines. If you're looking for a dot grid notebook, this is a very good option, as is the large.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Frazier

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED DAMAGED NOTEBOOK  :(
customer_reviews.text: I received the notebook and the color was gorgeous, the paper was lovely, everything was great BUT... a very sad and big BUT it had a two inch slash on the backside which I did not see until after I had opened the packaging. Very disappointed to receive a damaged notebook on my first Moleskine buy. I was so excited about getting it too. #SAD
customer_reviews.author: DePlume

customer_reviews.title: Great analogue feel for those who still love to wield ...
customer_reviews.text: These things have luxuriously thick pages to write on, and yet they're pliable and soft. The color of the paper is slightly off white. Great analogue feel for those who still love to wield a pen. I've had the bookmark ribbon break off quickly in the last two I've bought, but the band that holds it closed has never failed me. Has a pocket in the back for random scraps of paper. I assume the cover material is pleather, but I like the feel. A pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Darren F.

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line Journals !
customer_reviews.text: Great for avid writers. Moleskin is my favorite. Thick enough paper so pens don’t easily bleed through, good distance with lines, well made with a hidden pocket in the black and marker to make it easy to find where you left of and of course the strap to keep it closed. Plenty of colors when you make it through one book and go to the next
customer_reviews.author: Devon Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent journal
customer_reviews.text: high quality paper, light cream in color, narrow ruled (just like I like it), excellent binding, slim with slightly flexible, durable covers, making it easy to carry along in a pack or brief case, ..exactly what the extensive journalist wants in a journal. Do kind of miss page numbers, but that's okay, none of the journals I've used in the past decade had page numbers...
customer_reviews.author: lillirose51

customer_reviews.title: Start here for your art journal needs!
customer_reviews.text: If I could only express how much I love Moleskine sketchbooks. These are amazing and receive multiple mediums well. I use pencil, pen, watercolor, and acrylic in mine. With excessive water. The paper will warp slightly, but still has a quality look. If you use alcohol inks, the ink will leak through. The spine of the soft cover expands perfectly to allow your journal to grow along with your art. I will not use any others!
customer_reviews.author: E. enns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect workhorse sketchbook
customer_reviews.text: If you fill up sketchbooks fast, but don't want to switch over to single sheets/rolls of paper, then this is the perfect journal for you. Smooth paper, lots of pages, off-white color to deter eye strain, this is the perfect workhorse sketchbook that you use to make yourself better. Good drawings, bad drawings, it doesn't matter, you won't feel guilty as you would with filling up the art moleskine, but you also won't have to deal with using sketchbooks that feel like nails on a chalkboard. This is the perfect companion to any fancy sketchbook/paper you use for your finished illustrations, as this is where all of the building and planning will be done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book is my back up brain.
customer_reviews.text: I use this book daily to keep track of my schedule, menu plan, take meeting notes, etc. It has plenty of pages, is durable and is a beautiful color. It doesn't have a holder for a pen, but I place the elastic closure so it wraps around the bottom two corners, which creates an angle I can slip a pen under.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe I spent $23 on a notebook
customer_reviews.text: But I did, and it’s great. I get notebooks at work for free, so you’d think I would use those instead, but there is just something about a moleskine. I’ve had a few of the smaller ones before but this is my first with the dots. I’m not going back. The dots don’t get in the way when I need to draw diagrams and provide enough of a suggestion to keep my notes in a straight line. So simple, so expensive, so worth it
customer_reviews.author: mc16

customer_reviews.title: Damn
customer_reviews.text: The book size is great. The color is beautiful and it lays flat (for the most part). The paper however is so thin that after you color on it, it feels like it's perpetually wet. I'm still using it and will make due by gluing pages together for thickness. Not impressed but like I said I'll keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: JustJules

customer_reviews.title: Great for writers
customer_reviews.text: Im a writer and I love moleskins. I use them to outline and brainstorm novels. They hold up well, the pages have narrow lines, which I like, and the paper is a nice off-white. It erases really nice too. The paper is high-quality and holds up well. I love the elastic strap that holds it together and the pocket in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta in Indiana

customer_reviews.title: This notebook meets my needs or simple journaling
customer_reviews.text: This notebook appears to be adequate to meet my needs for general note-taking. I had to take two stars away because the product has an unusual smell to it. It could be the cover, but the overall aroma/smell is that of burnt plastic. I wonder if the smell would go away if I aired it out somewhere? Has anyone else experienced this situation as well?
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love to use Moleskine notebooks for my job and I picked up this pretty blue one to use at home during the Covid 19 crisis. I love the color and it has all my favorite Moleskin features, including the fact that it is lined, has a strap to close it, a ribbon bookmark and a folder/pocket in the back. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Thin pages = not for artists
customer_reviews.text: I bought this intending to use it as a sketchbook for art, and while it is a nice size, the pages are very thin. The only medium I can really use is pencil, while I prefer to use a larger variety of mediums. You can't really use both sides of each page, unless you don't mind it being see through. Colored pencils work fine, but markers or paints would bleed right through. I would recommend this to someone just looking to take notes, or write things down, but I would definitely not recommend this to anyone who wishes to use it for art.
customer_reviews.author: Sableye

customer_reviews.title: Can see through the paper
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the paper in this notebook is much worse quality than the older versions. Writing with any kind of pen not only shows through to the other side of the page, but also leaves an imprint. For the cost, I would not recommend these new moleskines, which is sad as I very much loved my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: D. ForstTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Color and Feel, Provides a Ton of Writing Space
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful notebook. Love the color - which is closer to dark pink than dark orchid. Very soft, buttery cover with a convenient stretchy band to keep the notebook closed and a silky ribbon to act as a bookmark. I plan on using this as a personal journal and this will provide a ton of writing space, with extra large, ruled pages. May not be a thick book, but the pages on which to write will allow for a massive amount of writing. Really happy with this notebook and you can't beat Moleskine.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Calling all bullet journalers who don't mind using pencils!
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy for bullet journal use. I can fold it over, tuck a pencil in it, throw it in my bag and on the floorboard of the car, and it holds up to all this abuse like a champ. The minus one star is because the pages are thin and if I were to use pen there'd be a lot of bleed. But I've embraced pencils. I use a Prismatic pencil sharpener and an old-fashioned pencil, and this setup works really well for me. I haven't used pencils in ten years, since I took a math class for my B.A. It's kind of nice to embrace them again.
customer_reviews.author: hangnail

customer_reviews.title: I love the extra large soft cover plain moleskins
customer_reviews.text: I love the extra large soft cover plain moleskins. They're the perfect size to really get your thoughts on one page and yet they fold up and fit in my purse so I can take notes on the go. They open pretty flat, and stay open by themselves, so writing in the center and on the non-dominant page is easy. The covers also fold back on each other, and provide support when you don't have a surface to write on. There's a reason writers have been using them for years. They're a treat to write in.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect notebook
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is absolutely perfect. The faux-leather cover is sturdy yet flexible. The paper is ultra-smooth and nice to write on. I write with Pilot G2 pens (the thick, 1.0mm variety) and they do not bleed through as another reviewer said. There's an elastic strap to keep the book closed in my bag, and a cloth bookmark to keep my place. The pocket in the back is bigger than expected, and it looks very professional. Great for both work and school. Overall, this is a very high quality notebook. May be a bit overpriced, but so long as it stands the test of time I will definitely purchase more of them.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Classic but thin pages
customer_reviews.text: Moleskines are classic. The brand has an extensive line of notebooks from lined notebooks to notebooks with a theme to even planners. I have always liked them. The only continuous issue I’ve had has been the paper inside is thin. In this notebook, I used ballpoint pens and it’s ok but they do ghost onto the other side of the page.
customer_reviews.author: Jacekleen

customer_reviews.title: Great for notes! (with markers!) Flexible pages!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE writing notes in this. I use markers and the bleed through is really not that bad, I didn't get distracted when studying at all, (and I easily find things to get distracted over). I used the papermate fine marker pens and they worked awesome. A pilot G2 bold will show through, but again, nothing distracting for me. I hate when pages are stiff and sturdy, these are thin, but really flexible and fluid. I also got the soft cover, and again, I love it. I will buy more once I use this one. No smudging for the markers.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought to use as a trip diary for a journey that was going to be too long to fit into a standard trip journal the quality of the product means I can see myself buying more of them for similar specific purposes. The moleskin is a novelty, the pouch on the inside back cover is useful for storing a few leaflets of paper and the binding appears strong. Certainly it has withstood being jammed with innumerable mementos. The whole thing is kept tidy with the elastic that is firmly attached to the body of notebook. No way would you ordinarily pay this much for a mere notebook but for a specific project this makes a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Another top notch product from Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: As always, Moleskine has produced a top notch product with regard to both quality and usability. The larger size is perfect for my needs and the soft cover permits all sorts of flexibility with writing - even folding the front cover back to making it possible to write on unsupported by a table. And the dots, I just love the dots. They are not as restrictive as lines yet offer more structure than the plain paper. Thanks for continuing to make quality products that are useful and practical.
customer_reviews.author: Highest Intentions

customer_reviews.title: Not Great With Fountain Pens
customer_reviews.text: A super cute cover, and the color is as fabulous as it appears online. However the paper's a little thin and allows more bleed than, say, a Rhodia notebook when writing with a fountain pen. It's worth noting that I write lightly with a fine-nib pen, so I imagine that any similar pen would cause the same problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Panagakis

customer_reviews.title: Extremely see-through :(
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the biggest wastes of money I've ever done. Yes, the notebook is large and pretty and clean and all you want, but every time you write something you can see it through to the other page! So much so that even if you write in pencil, the pages on the flip side are virtually unusable. Forget writing in pen, or you'll ruin the next two pages. Just look at a few of the pictures people have posted. So disappointing, coming from moleskine..
customer_reviews.author: nateL

customer_reviews.title: Great item, ruined by lousy packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great notebook and as someone who always purchased pain, I have to admit the dots are amazing for staying neat and organized without feeling hemmed in. So five star product! But the item I received from Bookexpress was bent and creased but bad packaging that allowed it to be folded over and stuffed into a mailbox. So I have a permanently creased cover and about forty pages with three looking creases. These creases are also big enough that the notebook didn't lie flat. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ingmar Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: gr8
customer_reviews.text: Moleskines are beautiful and writing in them makes you feel like whatever you are writing is important. Every detail on the notebook is thought out, simple, and elegant. No one I have ever met can say a single bad thing about this notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Ina Grose

customer_reviews.title: My best friend.........I use these for story writing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect note book, I am a writer and put my org. written story in them.....then use the computer to ship ship it off. This is one way to fill a book shelf and keep it small........LOL I always use the grid style from my archaeology days, because I like to block print.......and the note books are easy to tote.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: This Journal?  Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Moleskine has always been synonymous with high quality. I've used them for years for journaling. Because I am getting back into writing after a hiatus (ahem, baby), I decide to splurge on a large Moleskine notebook to collect my thoughts and ideas. Unfortunately, this journal? Sucks. The paper quality is so terribly thin that only one side is useable with a gel pen. The Five Star composition notebook I bought for $1.50 at Target has thicker paper than this useless Moleskine. Unless you are only planning on using one side of the notebook anyway, skip this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to get these at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy to get these at a decent price. The mark up at a bricks & mortar store is absurd. @Amazon - hey, this is one of those things where it's really hard to narrow by the options. Moleskine has a lot of products. If you want a particular one, which I do, it's visually very hard to find it in the search results as they are now. I know some full stack development. I'd be glad to help you fix this! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jack W

customer_reviews.title: Quality decline; disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: So incredibly disappointed with the quality of this notebook. My first Moleskine (lined) was incredible and had sturdy pages, but the pages in this notebook (plain) are made with such thin paper that my ink one side of a sheet consistently bleeds to the back. I do write quite heavily, with Muji 0.38 pens, but I’ve purchased cheap blank composition books for $3 that have held up better than this. I’m actually really devastated, because I was so excited to fill another notebook. Will probably end up buying a Lechturm, even though they’re even more expensive. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Wanhua Liu

customer_reviews.title: This journal is great. For the most part
customer_reviews.text: This journal is great. For the most part, I really like it. The color of the cover and pages is pleasing. The paper is high quality although there is some bleeding that occurs with certain pens/markers. It doesn't take to glue very well, but I'm not sure this notebook was intended for gluing things into so I won't take off for that. Good number of pages in it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Notebook for Engineers
customer_reviews.text: As an Application Engineer for engineering software, I have to takes TONS of customer notes during demonstrations and workshops, so having a compact yet extremely study notebook with grid lines is a must, and this notebook delivers in spades. I've already filled up one and I'm on my second after about a year. Wouldn't be surprised if by the end of my career I've got a giant stack of identical notebooks, all of which are this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Blanford

customer_reviews.title: like all other Moleskine products I own
customer_reviews.text: This Moleskine, like all other Moleskine products I own, has met my expectations perfectly. The dotted pages allow for personalization that you don't get with lined. pages. The pages are thin, but durable. Staedtler fine liner pens don't bleed through the pages. My favorite part of this notebook is that the cover is soft and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love moleskin! I write a lot and have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. I love moleskin! I write a lot and have a million notebooks, it seems. I don’t know why I ever buy anything other than moleskin, I always hate other brands. The paper is the right kind of think/thin. I love thin paper, don’t know why just do. But it’s not so thin as to rip or bleed through. Also If you get the lined it’s a little thinner lines than college ruled and I love that. I love narrow ruled!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS NOTEBOOK!!!💙💙💙💙
customer_reviews.text: As a math major, it's really hard to find a notebook that is good for everything: doing the general algebra work, drawing graphs and writing proofs. But this notebook is perfect for everything! It's beautifully crafted and I love the soft cover more than the hard covers. The pages are soft and the ink does not bleed through the pages. It's truly wonderful. I got it for only $13 in comparison to buying it directly from Moleskine for $20-$25. This is an over great notebook 👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria C.

customer_reviews.title: Great new product!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic new softcover notebooks. They have paper like the XL Caher notebooks with college ruled lines and the covers are like the other softcovers. The best part is that the covers will stay flat when placed on the table after you pressed down on the spine. You can even fold the cover over to the back and write on one sheet like a spiral bound notebook, although the pages won't sit as flat. Everything else is just like other Moleskines:. the elastic band, the back pocket, and the personal info/rewards front page.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: Leda vs Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to try this one because i usually go with "Leda"... i like the binding more on the moleskine. the cover is smoother which is better for all the stickers i like to cover my sketchbooks in. but the pages are so thin, in that respect, Leda is better. Essentially paper is paper, and i can still draw on it.
customer_reviews.author: BeRandy

customer_reviews.title: I love writing in this notebook.  It just feels good!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Moleskine notebook (the first one was exactly the same as this, with ruled lines but blue). I use it as a journal. I read some of the negative comments about it in other reviews, and they look accurate -- no, it doesn't lay perfectly flat, and I've got a feeling that the paper is too thin for a penetrating fountain pen's ink. However, that said, I love writing in this journal. The pages are large enough for me to "tell my story", and the quality is more solid than other notebooks I have used. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LindaB

customer_reviews.title: The Moleskin notebooks are my favorite. Whether you want to journal
customer_reviews.text: The Moleskin notebooks are my favorite. Whether you want to journal, just jot down quick thoughts, or use for work; you can't go wrong. The paper is high quality and you will have smooth writing no matter what type of pen or pencil you want to use. I love the flexible cover and softness of it. My only complaint is I wish you could easily remove pages from the book without affecting the integrity of the notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Karl D

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to finish one of these
customer_reviews.text: But it's a nice build and it's soft, college-ruled, compact, strapped, mmmmmm. Walmart sometimes will have a $9 version of this, like Exceed or something is the brand, and it's just as nice if not more substantial and equally sleek, soft, etc. Just watch out for those wide-ruled posers.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hakim

customer_reviews.title: Used them for years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these notebooks for years and don't plan on stopping anytime soon. Journal is durable, holds it's form and pages for months of daily use, and the strap to secure the journal shut is great for maintaining the shape and integrity of the pages throughout use.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Bookmark ribbon comes unglued and falls out :(
customer_reviews.text: I'm a longtime Moleskinner and I won't buy it again. First time trying the XL version and it's a big disappointment. Namely: - Bookmark ribbon pulled out on the first day (sent it back) - 2nd Bookmark ribbon pulled out within 2 weeks (kept it anyway) - Page weight is not as described -- ballpoints bleed through - Beige color is bland
customer_reviews.author: J.D. Dube

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pricy, But You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit pricy, but it is certainly worth the extra coin. The notebook is perfectly shaped, and has a nice pocket built into the back cover. The pocket is the perfect size for paper that has been folded in half. The cover is not cardboard (like the covers in the three packs), instead, it is a thin faux-leather that is durable and stays open easily. The paper is thin, but not terribly so. Writing with sharpies wouldn't be a good idea, but it is thick enough for most pens to stay on their side of the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Averie Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The paper is thin
customer_reviews.text: I really like most things about this notebook. I like the place holder, elastic to keep it closed, size, the fact that the cover is a bit flexible, that it's unlined. However, like other reviewers have stated, the paper is very thin and even with normal ball-point pen I can see it on the other side of the paper. Which basically renders half the notebook unusable. I wish this had better paper but I won't be buying another one like it is.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Biron

customer_reviews.title: Great for planning.
customer_reviews.text: This is already the forth notebook I am buying. I used to buy the fatter book with 400 pages, but they are not for sale anymore. But is is really better. I am a planning addict and this book was made for me. It even has a pocket in the back to store newspaper clippings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brown

customer_reviews.title: my favorite moleskin
customer_reviews.text: My favorite moleskin, use it for everyday work use. If you're like me and hate lined pages, this is just the right size and wide enough per page to fit lots of writings and drawings of sorts! Only thing is the pocket folder in the back ripped out quicker than it thought, but I tend not to use too much so it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: tealrainbow

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Notebook
customer_reviews.text: I'm finally getting around to using this (almost a year later), and it's so great. I was intimidated at first, but it really is such a nice notebook. The pages are high quality, and I think the line spacing is nice. Pen doesn't bleed all the way through the pages, but can sometimes be seen on the other side, but not badly. Definitely a worthwhile purchase now that I'm actually writing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam V Kramer

customer_reviews.title: best game in town
customer_reviews.text: best game in town. soft leather, back pocket, elastic band. i exclusively use moleskine for my journal/notebook needs. never a disappointment, except when they don't have gridded pages in stock, that's a bummer. but I like this size because it fits in most bags and is fairly durable, despite having a relatively soft cover. the advantage to the soft cover is that it folds over on itself easily when you need to write on the backs of pages.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Graebner

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Best notebooks on this planet. All my important stuff goes in Moleskin notebooks. Moleskin if you’re out there pls make a notebook with alternating blank AND lined pages in it :) and white! So I can dye sublimate it 🥰📚
customer_reviews.author: Martica

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect. Plus it's dotted
customer_reviews.text: I normally would buy the hardcover Moleskines, but I was just looking for something that would sit on my desk. This was perfect. Plus it's dotted. Which is pretty sweet. No lines everywhere. No lines nowhere. You can connect dots if you want lines. BOOM. 10/10 would recommend for all people with hands.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever! Durable flexible construction!
customer_reviews.text: Best ever. I've gone through many note books. Favorite part is flexibility, you can fold the book open (flip pages back) 360 degrees such that you can take notes in a meeting or presentation, or write while on an airplane, with the book only taking half the space in your lap or on a desk. And, the spine does not begin to break apart or lose durability. It's just great. Book also feels great. Only thing that would be better is if there were some perforated edges to tear pages out. But not a big issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: LKT

customer_reviews.title: Prettay pretty good but pages are way too thin
customer_reviews.text: Pages are thinner than I expected but the paper still has a good amount of tooth to it so I guess it's ok. I only drew in it once to test it, I need to finish my other one first, so if it spontaneously combusts or something, I'll have to edit this review. EDIT: I've used it some more and I have to say, I wish the pages were thicker. I can only draw on one side (with PENCIL) because you can perfectly see through the pages. OH WELL.
customer_reviews.author: Karannmor

customer_reviews.title: Classic for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Perfect size for notes, sketches, also has a nice little pocket, and the elastic to keep it all tidy and together and the cover is sturdy. I also love that they come in cute colors, so I can organize my subjects topically, or keep track of notes chronologically. I like options.
customer_reviews.author: G.B. Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Great little sketchbook
customer_reviews.text: Great little sketchbook. This thing is the perfect size to tote around and I like that it is flexible but durable. The paper is neither too thick nor too thin, and it isn't a super bright white either, which I appreciate, as working on a piece or several hours that is on really bright paper can irritate my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Tattoo Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebooks
customer_reviews.text: Have used a couple moleskin notebooks for work. This is my favorite by far (dotted) easy to take notes at work as the grid style allows for drawings, charts, alignment and other ways to organize info. My go to from now on!
customer_reviews.author: RyRy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love the freedom of dots instead of lines or grids. I can do quick proportional sketches, charts, and reasonably accurate drafts of dimensions while still being able to write as if there were lines. I love how the dots are not too light or too dark. The notebook has a soft cover which makes it easy for me to bring around. The quality of the paper is great also. Nice to the touch like all moleskine notebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Lex N

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and awesome journal, but smells fishy
customer_reviews.text: The notebook is great and is very satisfying to write in, but the paper had a strong, powerful fish smell to them. The only thing I can come up with for the reason they smell like that is the glue. I placed two of these notebooks in my closet, and my whole closet smelled of them! I had to cover them in a plastic bag. Uni-ball bold point pens were incredibly well with the paper and do not bleed through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Love the Notebooks, but I can't handle the Ghosting on the Paper!
customer_reviews.text: I have to preface with the fact that I mostly LOVE these notebooks. The color selections, size, and feel of the paper is mostly great. Writing on these is like a dream! But the 70 gsm paper ghosts so much onto the next page, my notes are a mess. Probably wont repurchase, which i'm really sad about because i really wanna love this notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana Morales

customer_reviews.title: Multiple purchases, DAMAGED
customer_reviews.text: Love the notebooks, but buy somewhere else who can figure out how to ship. Edge damage on each one I purchased from Amazon. No way to get the info back to them without send the notebook back, not so convenient and I need the notebook is the reason I bought it. Buy from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: My favorite notebooks for writing and drawing
customer_reviews.text: Moleskin books have the right size and feel for me. The paper is thin, but not too thin for writing and sketching. This notebook has a pocket in the back, which I think is unnecessary and just adds to the price, but I do like the elastic that holds the book together, and the inbuilt bookmark. The book lies flat, and easily folds over without breaking the spine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coppedge

customer_reviews.title: History is written and documented.
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal. I got it just a week ago and love writing in it. It is really big, which I was unsure of, but I love this notebook. The feel of it and look is perfect. I highly recommend this to anyone. The smaller ones are a bit better for carrying around, but this is just such a great beside notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: My favorite notebook
customer_reviews.text: I've had many styles of the Moleskin notebook, but I really love the unlined soft-shell. I like that it carries nicely in my large tote bags, works well for doodling and note-taking, has the handy back pocket, and doesn't tear up quite as easy as the hard-shells did by rolling around in my bag daily.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth BaurTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pages were thinner and much different than the ones I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Pages were thinner and much different than the ones I've bought before. Haven't been able to even use it. Unfortunate since Moleskine is suppose to be more dependent than your average 5 star notebooks
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Ali

customer_reviews.title: I love my Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: I love my Moleskine! I use it as an agenda, so it sees a lot of daily use, and is frequently thrown in and out of my backpack. Other reviews report that the pages are pretty thin, and they appear to be, but I've never had a problem with them. I mainly use Staedtler Fineliner pens on the pages and only the darker colors seem to show through on the other side. Doesn't bother me too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft and classic
customer_reviews.text: If you're an artist used to the smaller, hardbound size of Moleskine with the cardstock pages, it's worth noting that this one has a soft leather binding with much thinner pages--however the soft cover makes it excellent as an on the go sketchbook suitable for pencil and light pen work. The pages are thin, so be advised that drawings or writing do show through to the next page. I like to use this for rough sketches and concept work, so this works fine for me and is great for refining sketches on the opposite side of the page.
customer_reviews.author: Kells

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn’t love moleskin.
customer_reviews.text: Live moleskin notebooks. I actually spent more time writing with them due to the quality of the notebook. People always ask where I get my moleskin and like me they also love the look and feel. Who knew a notebook could be so exciting?
customer_reviews.author: Laureninvt

customer_reviews.title: 99% Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The notebook is a great size and has pages which don’t allow bleeding. I love the dot grid because of organizational purposes, but don’t restrict creativity with harsh lines (such as a regular graph paper). The only thing I would change though is that when you write on it, you can see your writing faintly on the other side of the page. I’m choosing to not write on the front AND back of a page for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: E. Westermark

customer_reviews.title: Moleskine is a great brand for me
customer_reviews.text: Moleskine is a great brand for me, because I'm left 👈, good quality, durable, a good look and feel for my notes at work. Just a suggestion, I would like that you made other colors in that size XL, soft cover, ruled, classic notebook!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for my life!
customer_reviews.text: I have like a whole stack of these - they are a bit pricey, but I just love the classic look and feel. These books make an understated statement and are easily identifiable to "those in the know." Yes, I am a Moleskine junkie and in the days of digital everything, I still prefer the feeling of writing on paper with pen to get my thoughts out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tiemann

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: I really like everything about this notebook except for two things. 1) The pages are pretty thin. You can see everything through the page, even when written with just a regular pen. 2) The band that wraps around the cover to keep the notebook closed is made of cheap elastic. I've only had mine for about 3 weeks and I'm thinking about just cutting it off because it's already loose
customer_reviews.author: K. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality notebook
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my husband for Christmas. He loves it. It’s bigger than I was picturing and will definitely not fit in an Xmas stocking in case you were wondering.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Wachh

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the size! I use it as my bullet journal and it's big enough for me to write down all my tasks. The softer cover works well when I throw it into my purse. I don't have to worry about it getting damaged or broken. My only complaint would be the pages are not numbered and they are thinner than my Leuchtturm1917. This sometimes causes the ink to bleed through and there is quite a bit of ghosting. Other than that, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: sjones

customer_reviews.title: At last!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best notebook I've ever used. It's slim and fits easily in a bag or purse. The binding works equally well for left- or right-handed writers. And the squared lines are the perfect size/weight for note taking or drawing. I'm a copious note-taker, and it took me nearly 11 months to fill my first notebook. So they're expensive, but I don't seem to blow through them like I do other notebooks. I LOVE THESE NOTEBOOKS!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Below Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had a 3 pack of Moleskine's that ran out. They were fantastic so I ordered another thinking I would be getting a similar product. Nope! The pages are much thinner and fall out every time I write! I have pages of notes just sitting, unbound in my notebook :(
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for journaling, wish pages were a tad thicker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size, hand-fill, and line-spacing for me. Allows you to put a lot of words on a page in a thin, portable notebook. I have a bit of a heavy hand when writing, so there are a lot of "pen lines" on the back of my pages. (I can feel what I've written on the back of the page with a ball-point pen), which is a little distracting to me when writing on the back of the page. Overall, nothing that's a big deal, just wish the pages were a tad thicker. Notebook folds back nicely, and binding seems to be holding up well after several months.
customer_reviews.author: Scrockern

customer_reviews.title: It is fine if you're just doing pencil sketches or notes
customer_reviews.text: Paper is not what I expected since there is a lot of hype around the Moleskine books. It is fine if you're just doing pencil sketches or notes, but it is not thick, quality paper, like I was expecting. It also came with the corner already smashed--wrinkled beyond what I might be able to flatten/press out. I will use it, but will not be purchasing another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: I love moleskin notebooks
customer_reviews.text: I love moleskin notebooks. I really like the quality and feel of this notebook, as well as the large pages with the small lines and no indent. What I don't like is getting my new notebook in the mail and having an dent in both top corners that also effects all of the pages. It seems maybe it was damaged while shipping by having heavy boxes put on top. It would be nice if more care was taken in preventing that from happening after paying over $20 for it. I would return it if I didn't need it right away, but the bent corner and pages are going to bug me every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kass

customer_reviews.title: I love this notebook as an art journal/journal
customer_reviews.text: I love this notebook as an art journal/journal. I have two older journals that have "bloomed" to 5"...but do so easily because of the soft cover and sturdy binding.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy P

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook for left handers!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and large. It's almost the size of a regular notebook which I love. It lasts really flat which is great for me as a left handed person. The only problem I have work it is it seems to take longer to in to dry which is a down side since my hand drags through it when I write because I'm left handed. It's a great notebook!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mowen

customer_reviews.title: The grid design is perfect for that
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second of these, and while they are more expensive than most notebooks, the quality is worth the price. I use it for journaling and tracking daily tasks. The grid design is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wallevand

customer_reviews.title: Moleskine makes the best notebooks
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic notebooks! I purchased a large quantity of these to give as gifts to my clients and kept a few for myself. My wife and I both use them and they serve their purpose well. The paper feels just right and writing in them has been enjoyable. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Yankowiak

customer_reviews.title: Gauze-thin pages, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality. See through, thin pages. Bleed through with ballpoint pen. Not worth the money. Unfortunately due to corona iris, I couldn’t return this item in time for a refund. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love Moleskine. The paper is the best part. Got it to make my own 18 month calendar. Worth the price due to quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Nunez

customer_reviews.title: My Choice for Journaling!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased another just like this one for my journaling and LOVED IT so much that I insisted on the same type for my new journal! I absolutely love the flexible folder and the pages that lie flatish without much effort. I tend to write with either colored pens or gel pens and there is little intereference on the flip side of the page and absolutely no bleed through. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

product_meta.title: Moleskine Classic Notebook, Soft Cover, XL (7.5" x 9.5") Plain/Blank, Black, 192 Pages
product_meta.description:
Style:Plain| Color:BlackThe Soft Cover extra large notebook with plain pages has a flexible yet sturdy cover that adapts to the movements of the body and fits comfortably in any pocket. This is a reliable travel companion, perfect for writings, thoughts and passing notes. Every Moleskine product is thread bound and has a soft cover with rounded corners, acid free paper, a bookmark, an elastic closure and an expandable inner pocket that contains the Moleskine history. 

Specifications: 
- Layout: Plain Paper
- Dimensions: 7 1/2" x 10"
- Soft Cover with elastic closure and bookmark ribbon.
- Color: Black
- Pages: 192
- Paper Weight: 70 gsm/47 lb.; FSC Certified Paper; Acid-Free (pH Neutral)
- Internal Accordion Pocket


AMAZON.COM





MOLESKINE NOTEBOOK & JOURNALS COMPARISON
Series Classic Notebooks Evernote Smart Notebooks Classic Notebooks - Reporter Volant Notebooks Cahier Notebooks Brief Description The Moleskine icon. Always at the ready, these thread-bound classic notebooks capture your thoughts, drafts, sketches, notes, appointments, contacts, or anything else you choose. Write, sketch, or draw in the specially designed Evernote Notebooks by Moleskine. Take a photo of any page in this Moleskine notebook with the Evernote Page Camera and it instantly becomes digital so that you can save it, search it and share it with the world. The Moleskine Pocket Ruled Reporter notebook has a cover that flip opens at the top, detachable pages at the back for quick notes on the spot and can be used both horizontally and vertically. A colored collection of soft cover notebooks and journals ideal for everyday use. Volant notebooks come packed in sets of two, consisting of two different shades of the same colour. It's a notebook so lightweight you'll forget about it - until you need it. The journals for day-to-day use, Cahier notebooks each have a heavy duty cardboard cover with visible stitching on the spine that matches the cover color. Slim, soft and light - Cahier journals suit any occasion, and come packaged in sets of three. XL Plain Cranberry Red, XL Ruled Cranberry Red, XL Squared Cranberry Red White XS Plain, XS Ruled, Pkt Plain, Pkt Ruled, LG Plain, LG Ruled 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Classic Collection featuring bold new colors and a variety of page layouts just waiting to be filled with your ideas. Including all the characteristic elements of the legendary notebook: rounded corners, ivory pages, elastic closure, bookmark ribbon and expandable back pocket - enclosed within a colorful hard cover. - Colored Soft Cover Classic Notebook 
- Rounded corners
- Elastic closure 
- Moleskine ivory paper
- Matching ribbon bookmark 
- Paper: 70 gsm, acid-free, ivory, lined
- “Incase of Loss” printed on the flyleaf
- Expandable inner pocket in the back
- Reusable paperband B-SIDE featuring additional printed tools
- Lies flat, opens at 180° 
- The history of Moleskine is inside

- Moleskine Srl creates and sells FSC-certified products

See more
feature_bullets: CLASSIC MOLESKINE NOTEBOOK: Moleskine classic notebooks are perfect notebooks for writing journals, a daily diary, or note taking in college classes or meetings. Moleskine notebooks are beloved by travelers & bullet journalists for their slim design.

DURABLE COVER & ELASTIC CLOSURE: Hold writing projects & notes in your Moleskine notebook with an elastic closure band & inner storage folders. Leather-like classic Moleskine cover & thick, ivory paper pages are perfect for writing with fountain pens.

DURABLE COVER & ELASTIC CLOSURE: Hold writing projects & notes in your Moleskine notebook with an elastic closure band & inner storage folders. Leather-like classic Moleskine cover & thick, ivory paper pages are perfect for writing with fountain pens.

GIFT QUALITY NOTEBOOKS: Moleskine planners, journals and notebooks come in hardcover or softcover and colors like black, red, blue, green and brown. The binding and cover have a durable finish, designed for daily journaling, writing and sketching.

DELUXE QUALITY PAGES: Moleskine's thick, ivory paper pages in a hardcover Moleskine notebook, softcover Moleskine notebook, cahier or volant journal, or Moleskine planner are perfectly textured for writing with a ballpoint pen, fountain pen, or pencil.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,808 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
